Abstract: The spatial and temporal organization of chromatin plays a pivotal role in regulating gene expression and maintaining genomic integrity. This study delves into the intricate mechanisms governing chromatin architecture at both small and large scales, focusing on the dynamic interplay between DNA, nucleosomes, and higher-order chromatin structures. We explore the role of loop extrusion in shaping chromatin topology and its implications for epigenetic regulation. By integrating recent advances in chromatin biology, we aim to elucidate how chromatin organization influences cellular function and disease states. Our findings underscore the complexity of chromatin dynamics and highlight the importance of understanding these processes for advancing our knowledge of genome regulation and epigenetic inheritance.
